idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7600) ; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

descript.abstract: United States 112th Congressional Districts is a polygon theme representing the political boundaries for the U.S. 112th congressional districts. The official membership is current as of February 7, 2012.
descript.purpose: U.S. 112th Congressional Districts provides the locations of congressional districts, primarily for national planning applications.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:100,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, you may contact Esri Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded.
Outside the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/about-esri/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

enttyp.enttypd: An area established by state officials or the courts for the purpose of electing a person to the U.S. House of Representatives. Within each state, these areas must contain, as nearly as possible, an equal number of inhabitants. The number of congressional districts in each state may change after each decennial census, and the boundaries may be changed more than once during a decade.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The name of the representative for the congressional district.
attr.attrdefs: Clerk of the U.S. House of Representatives

attr.attrdef: The political party of the representative for the congressional district.
attr.attrdefs: Clerk of the U.S. House of Representatives

edom.edomvd: The representative has resigned, died, or declined to serve.

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (two-digit number) for the state in which the congressional district is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for the state in which the congressional district is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The 2010 estimated population of the congressional district.
The area of the congressional district in square miles.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: Data & Maps is available only as part of Esri software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

citeinfo.title: 2009 TIGER/Line Shapefiles; Census 2000: State and State Equivalent Areas, 2012

serinfo.sername: TIGER/Line Shapefiles; Census State and State Equivalent Areas

citeinfo.othercit: The TIGER/Line Shapefiles are an extract of selected geographic and cartographic information from the Census MAF/TIGER database. The Census MAF/TIGER database represents a seamless national file with no overlaps or gaps between parts.

citeinfo.origin: Clerk of the U.S. House of Representatives
citeinfo.title: UNOFFICIAL LIST OF MEMBERS; OFFICIAL LIST OF MEMBERs, 2012

pubinfo.publish: Clerk of the U.S. House of Representatives

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Copied the latest Esri Data & Maps U.S. 111th Congressional Districts dataset. Downloaded the most current list of members from http://clerk.house.gov/member_info/unofficial-list-by-state-112.pdf and updated fields NAME and PARTY. Converted the data set to SDC. Created projection file (.prj) and spatial indices.

The following steps were performed by Esri: Copied the latest Esri Data & Maps U.S. 112th Congressional Districts dataset. Downloaded the most current list of members from http://clerk.house.gov/member_info/olm-112.pdf and updated fields NAME and PARTY. Converted the data set to SDC. Created projection file (.prj) and spatial indices.

The following steps were performed by Esri: Copied the latest Data & Maps U.S. 112th Congressional Districts dataset. Downloaded the most current list of members from http://clerk.house.gov/member_info/olm-112.pdf and updated fields NAME and PARTY. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

horizpa.horizpar: Coordinates in the TIGER/Line shapefiles have six implied decimal places, but the positional accuracy of these coordinates is not as great as the six decimal places suggest. The positional accuracy is unknown.

dataqual.logic:
The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify, validate, and if needed repair the geometry.
The Census Bureau performed automated tests to ensure logical consistency and limits of shapefiles and performed spatial data tests for logical consistency of the codes during the compilation of the original Census MAF/TIGER database files.
dataqual.complete:
After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
[Applies to the coastline only - Line simplification and smoothing was performed with a tolerance of 0.005 decimal degrees and a coordinate reduction using the Douglas-Peucker method with a tolerance of 0.0003 decimal degrees. Very small polygons were eliminated when the combination of geographic codes existed elsewhere.]
